purpleculture_pinyin:
wǎng
to twist; crooked; unjust; in vain
крутить; кривой; несправедливый; напрасно
purpleculture_info:
Antonyms: 正
Pictophonetic: 王 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
枉法 [ wǎng fǎ ]: to circumvent the law
贪赃枉法 [ tān zāng wǎng fǎ ]: corruption and abuse of the law (idiom); to take bribes and bend the law
不枉 [ bù wǎng ]: not in vain
枉死 [ wǎng sǐ ]: to die in tragic circumstances
枉然 [ wǎng rán ]: in vain; to no avail
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 王 [ wáng ] king, ruler; royal; surname
heisig_chinese_memo: The king wants every tree in the kingdom to stand straight up.  Any crooked trees will be chopped down immediately.
Ru_trainchinese: wǎng: (графема) напрасно, зря; несправедливый, неправильный, искажённый, изогнутый
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The king wants every tree in the kingdom to stand straight up.  Any crooked trees will be chopped down immediately.
humanum_full_description_en:
" 𣒈 " from the characters of the Warring States Period and Xiaozhuan, from the sound of " wood " and "㞷". The official script was changed from the voice of " king ", which will be used by later generations. See "㞷". The original meaning of " in vain " is bending. "Said Wen": "Wan, 衺quye. Congmu, 𡉚 sound." Such as "Xunzi. King Domination: "It's too late to pass, but it is to stand up straight and seek its shadow in vain." "Book of Rites. Throw the pot": "Someone has a vain target or a whistle pot, please use a robin." Zheng Xuan's note: "Wait, whistle, not upright."

"In vain " by extension means dishonesty. Such as "The Analects. For politics": "If the people are wrong, the people will be persuaded; if they are wrong, the people will not accept them." " Wrong " is the same as " measures ", meaning rejection. Another example is "Mencius. Teng Wengong Part 2" "Whoever is in vain, there is no one who can straighten others." Han Zhaoqi's note: "People should be straightforward to correct their ears."

"In vain " means violation or distortion. Such as "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Congzheng" A Pian Jian 15+5: "For profit, then 𧶗 (greed)." It means to break the law for the sake of profit, which is greed. (See Chen Jian, Chen Meilan) Another example is "Han Feizi. Eight Sayings: "In the kingdom of the Lord, officials dare not violate the law, and officials dare not act for personal gain."

"In vain " means wronged, wronged. Such as "Warring States Policy. "Han Ce II": "Yan Zhongzi is the prime minister of the princes, not far away thousands of miles, riding in vain, and entrusting his ministers." Three Kingdoms Shu Zhuge Liang "Previously Distinguished Teachers List": "The first emperor does not treat his ministers as despicable. In the Cao Lu, the counsellors take the matter of the world."

"In vain " means wronged. Such as "Hou Han Shu. Liu Xuan and Liu Penzi Biographies: "So those who are loyal to the monarchs do not want profit, but use the county to kill them, and kill my son in vain, and want to repay the grievances." "Three Kingdoms. Wei Shu. "Noble Township Public Mao Biography": "On the first day of the first year of the Zhengyuan period in October, in the winter of October, the servants will be sent to the four sides to observe the customs, the laborers and the people who have been wronged and neglied."

"In vain " also means in vain and for nothing. For example, the second part of Li Bai's "Qing Ping Tiao" in the Tang Dynasty: "A sprig of red and beautiful dew condensed incense, and the cloud and rain in Wushan was in vain." Feng Menglong of the Ming Dynasty "Xing Shi Heng Yan. "San Xiaolian Let Chan Lie High Name": "It's just kind words to persuade, but I might not obey it. It was a waste of words to sow discord between his brothers."
humanum_short_description_en: " 𣒈 " from the characters of the Warring States and Xiaozhuan, from the sound of " wood " and "㞷". The official script was changed from the voice of " king ", which will be used by later generations. The original meaning is bending.
humanum_full_description:
戰國文字與小篆作「𣒈」，從「木」，「㞷」聲。隸書改從「王」聲，為後世所本。參見「㞷」。「枉」的本義是彎曲。《說文》：「枉，衺曲也。从木，𡉚聲。」如《荀子．王霸》：「過猶不及也，辟之是猶立直木而求其影之枉也。」《禮記．投壺》：「某有枉矢、哨壺，請以樂賓。」鄭玄注：「枉、哨，不正貌。」

　　「枉」引申表示不正直。如《論語．為政》：「舉直錯諸枉，則民服；舉枉錯諸直，則民不服。」「錯」同「措」，表示捨棄。又如《孟子．滕文公下》「枉己者，未有能直人者也。」漢趙岐注：「人當以直矯枉耳。」

　　「枉」表示違背、歪曲。如《上博竹書二．從政》甲篇簡15+5：「為利𣒈（枉）事，則𧶗（貪）。」意謂為了利益而違法斷事，就是貪。（參陳劍、陳美蘭）又如《韓非子．八說》：「明主之國，官不敢枉法，吏不敢為私利。」

　　「枉」表示委屈、屈就。如《戰國策．韓策二》：「而嚴仲子乃諸侯之卿相也，不遠千里，枉車騎而交臣。」三國蜀諸葛亮〈前出師表〉：「先帝不以臣卑鄙，猥自枉屈，三顧臣於草廬之中，咨臣以當世之事。」

　　「枉」表示冤屈。如《後漢書．劉玄劉盆子列傳》：「所以厚諸君者，非欲求利，徒以縣宰不道，枉殺吾子，欲為報怨耳。」《三國志．魏書．高貴鄉公髦傳》：「正元元年冬十月壬辰，遣侍中持節分適四方，觀風俗，勞士民，察冤枉失職者。」

　　「枉」還表示徒然、白白地。如唐代李白〈清平調〉之二：「一枝紅艷露凝香，雲雨巫山枉斷腸。」明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．三孝廉讓產立高名》：「就是好言相勸，料未必聽從，枉費了唇舌，到挑撥他兄弟不和。」
humanum_short_description: 戰國文字與小篆作「𣒈」，從「木」，「㞷」聲。隸書改從「王」聲，為後世所本。本義是彎曲。

②冤屈：枉死。冤枉。
③屈就，用于别人，含敬意：枉驾(ａ．称对方来访自己；b．请对方往访他人)。枉顾(称对方来访自己)。枉临(称对方来访自己)。

戰國文字與小篆作「 𣒈 」，從「 木 」，「 㞷 」聲。隸書改從「 王 」聲，為後世所本。參見「 㞷 」。「 枉 」的本義是彎曲。《說文》：「枉，衺曲也。从木，𡉚聲。」如《荀子．王霸》：「過猶不及也，辟之是猶立直木而求其影之枉也。」《禮記．投壺》：「某有枉矢、哨壺，請以樂賓。」鄭玄注：「枉、哨，不正貌。」 「 枉 」引申表示不正直。如《論語．為政》：「舉直錯諸枉，則民服；舉枉錯諸直，則民不服。」「 錯 」同「 措 」，表示捨棄。又如《孟子．滕文公下》「枉己者，未有能直人者也。」漢趙岐注：「人當以直矯枉耳。」 「 枉 」表示違背、歪曲。如《上博竹書二．從政》甲篇簡15+5：「為利𣒈（枉）事，則𧶗（貪）。」意謂為了利益而違法斷事，就是貪。（參陳劍、陳美蘭）又如《韓非子．八說》：「明主之國，官不敢枉法，吏不敢為私利。」 「 枉 」表示委屈、屈就。如《戰國策．韓策二》：「而嚴仲子乃諸侯之卿相也，不遠千里，枉車騎而交臣。」三國蜀諸葛亮〈前出師表〉：「先帝不以臣卑鄙，猥自枉屈，三顧臣於草廬之中，咨臣以當世之事。」 「 枉 」表示冤屈。如《後漢書．劉玄劉盆子列傳》：「所以厚諸君者，非欲求利，徒以縣宰不道，枉殺吾子，欲為報怨耳。」《三國志．魏書．高貴鄉公髦傳》：「正元元年冬十月壬辰，遣侍中持節分適四方，觀風俗，勞士民，察冤枉失職者。」 「 枉 」還表示徒然、白白地。如唐代李白〈清平調〉之二：「一枝紅艷露凝香，雲雨巫山枉斷腸。」明代馮夢龍《醒世恒言．三孝廉讓產立高名》：「就是好言相勸，料未必聽從，枉費了唇舌，到挑撥他兄弟不和。」

The official script was changed from the voice of " king", which will be used by later generations. See " 㞷". The original meaning of " in vain" is bending. "Said Wen": "Wan, 衺quye. Congmu, 𡉚 sound." Such as "Xunzi. King Domination: "It's too late to pass, but it is to stand up straight and seek its shadow in vain." "Book of Rites. Throw the pot": "Someone has a vain target or a whistle pot, please use a robin." Zheng Xuan's note: "Wait, whistle, not upright." "In vain" by extension means dishonesty. Such as "The Analects. For politics": "If the people are wrong, the people will be persuaded; if they are wrong, the people will not accept them." " Wrong" is the same as " measures", meaning rejection. Another example is "Mencius. Teng Wengong Part 2" "Whoever is in vain, there is no one who can straighten others." Han Zhaoqi's note: "People should be straightforward to correct their ears." "In vain" means violation or distortion. Such as "Shangbo Bamboo Book II. "Congzheng" A Pian Jian 15+5: "For profit, then 𧶗 (greed)." It means to break the law for the sake of profit, which is greed. (See Chen Jian, Chen Meilan) Another example is "Han Feizi. Eight Sayings: "In the kingdom of the Lord, officials dare not violate the law, and officials dare not act for personal gain." "In vain" means wronged, wronged. Such as "Warring States Policy. "Han Ce II": "Yan Zhongzi is the prime minister of the princes, not far away thousands of miles, riding in vain, and entrusting his ministers." "In vain" means wronged. Such as "Hou Han Shu. For example, the second part of Li Bai's "Qing Ping Tiao" in the Tang Dynasty: "A sprig of red and beautiful dew condensed incense, and the cloud and rain in Wushan was in vain." 枉字的基本解释

枉
wǎng
弯曲，弯屈，引申为行为不合正道或违法曲断：枉道。矫枉过正。贪脏枉法。枉己正人（自己身子不正，倒去矫正别人）。
冤屈：枉死。冤枉。
屈就，用于别人，含敬意：枉驾（ａ．称对方来访自己；ｂ．请对方往访他人）。枉顾（称对方来访自己）。枉临（称对方来访自己）。
徒然，空，白：枉然。枉自。枉费心机。

枉字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wǎng］
［《廣韻》紆往切，上養，影。］
亦作“抂1”。
(1)弯曲。
(2)谓迂曲。
(3)邪曲，不正直。亦指邪事或邪曲之人。
(4)错误，过失。
(5)谦词。谓使对方受屈。
(6)冤屈。
(7)绕。
(8)违背；歪曲。
(9)谓违法曲断，欺凌弱者。
(10)徒然；白费。
[②]［kuáng］
［《類篇》渠王切］
(1)汲具。
(2)通“狂”。乱貌。参见“枉2粧”、“枉2攘”。

枉字的英文翻译

◎ 枉
crooked, in vain, pervert, twist, wrong

枉字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　枉； 康熙笔画：8； 页码：页514第28
〔古文〕?【唐韻】【廣韻】迂往切【集韻】【類篇】【韻會】嫗往切，?汪上聲。【說文】衺曲也。【淮南子·時則訓】木熙者舉梧檟，據句枉。又人之不直者，亦謂之枉。【論語】舉直錯諸枉。　又屈也。【禮·月令】仲秋，命有司申嚴百?，毋或枉橈。　又冤也。【唐書·高仙芝傳】軍中皆呼枉。　又枉駕。【戰國策】聶政曰：仲子不遠千里枉車騎而交臣。　又枉矢，有三義：一【周禮·夏官·司弓矢】枉矢利火射。註今之飛矛是也。或謂之兵矢。一【禮·投壺】主人謂曰：某有枉矢哨壺，請以樂賓。【註】謙言不直之矢也。一星名。【考異郵】枉矢，狀如流星，蛇行有尾。　又【類篇】巨王切。汲具。

考證：〔【周禮·秋官·司?】救日以枉矢。【註】漢時名飛矛，用以守城利火射。〕　謹按秋官司?無救日以枉矢之文，註亦無漢時名飛矛之語。今照周禮改夏官司弓矢枉矢利火射。註今之飛矛是也。或謂之兵矢。〔【投壺禮】主人謂曰某有枉矢哨壺，以樂嘉賓。〕　謹按禮字應移於投壺之上。照原文謂字改請字
枉字的源字形

枉字的起名意思

冤枉。

in vain
Basic explanation of words
in vain
wǎng
Bend, bend, bend, behave unjustly or illegally: in vain. Overkill. Greedy and perverted law. In vain of self-righteousness (If you are not upright, go to correct others).
Injustice: in vain. Wronged.
Resignation, used for others, with respect: in vain (a. Call the other person to visit oneself; b. Ask the other person to visit others). In vain (call that the other party is visiting oneself). In vain (call that the other party is visiting oneself).
In vain, empty, white: in vain. In vain. In vain.
in vain
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wǎng］
["Guang Yun" cuts, raises, and shadows. ]
Also known as "抂1".
(1) Bending.
(2) It is called tortuosity.
(3) Evil music, not upright. It also refers to people who are evil things or evil music.
(4) Error, negligence.
(5) Modest words. Said to make the other party aggrieved.
(6) Injustice.
(7) Around.
(8) Violation; distortion.
(9) It is said that it is illegal to cut off and bully the weak.
(10) In vain; in vain.
[②]［kuáng］
["Classes" Qu Wangqie]
(1) Drawing tools.
(2) Through "crazy". Messy appearance. See "Wai 2 makeup", "Wai 2 humiliation".
in vain
English translation of words
◎ In vain
crooked, in vain, pervert, twist, wrong
in vain
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Chen Ji] [Wood Character Department] 　枉; Kangxi Strokes: 8; Page Number: Page 514 28
[Ancient text]? [Tang Yun] [Guang Yun] Detour to cut [Ji Yun] [Class Chapter] [Yun Hui] To cut the woman,? Wang Shangsheng. [Said the text] Qu also. [Huainanzi·Shi Zexun] The Muxi people held Wuju, according to the sentence in vain. People who are not straight are also said to be in vain. 【The Analects of Confucius】All right and wrong.　Yes again. [Rite·Yue Order] Zhongqiu, the order was ordered to be strict, not or in vain.　It's wrong again. [Tang Shu·Gao Xianzhi Biography] The military is in vain.　It's in vain again. [Warring States Policy] Nie Zheng said: Zhongzi rode a thousand miles in vain to pay his ministers.　It's also in vain, and there are three meanings: one [Zhou Li·Xiaguan·Si Gong Shi] in vain and fire. Note that today's flying spear is also. Or called the weapon. One [Li·Throwing Pot] The owner said: There is a whistle pot in vain, please use a robin. Пиктофонетические символы.
Письмо печати сделано из дерева, что означает, что древесина изогнута, а не прямая; звук черного (ван) означает, что растительность растет напрасно, а беспорядочно растущая растительность теряет свою целостность и прямолинейность.
Ли, обычное письмо Congmu (дерево), Wang (Ван) звук, Wang Tongwang, что означает, что деревья растут дико, но не прямо.
Первоначальный смысл в том, что древесина не прямая при изгибе.
Вообще говоря, изгиб не прямой.
①Изгиб; не прямой: исправление ~ вышележащее.
2 Сделайте искажение: один ~ метод | ~ перерыв.
3 обиженных; обиженных: ~ смерть | обиженных.
④ Скромные слова, означающие заставить собеседника нагнуться: ~ драйв.

Состояние 1
Нравиться,
wǎng
I прил./наречие
1) кривой, искривлённый, изогнутый; извилистый
枉径 извилистая тропа; кривой путь
2) неправильный, искажённый; несправедливый; облыжный
枉告 подать ложную жалобу
枉禁 несправедливо заточить в тюрьму
3) незаслуженный; безвинный; без вины
枉没 безвинно погибнуть
枉害 напрасно погубить (невиновного)
4) тщетный; понапрасну, зря
枉费了苦心 напрасно стараться (трудиться), зря тратить свои силы
II гл.
1) искривлять; портить; нарушать; искажать, извращать
枉粧 испортить свой убор, смазать грим (косметику)
2) эпист. соблаговолить, снизойти; удостоить, осчастливить (посещением)
